overview_of_class: This seminar will serve as an introduction to pedagogy for graduate students in history. It is designed to offer practical advice regarding the challenges of conceptualizing a course and writing a course description; compiling syllabi for lecture and seminar courses; leading discussions; organizing lectures; and grading. We will also consider how one might devise an actual teaching philosophy, not simply to compile a document for an employment dossier, but to plan a pedagogical agenda that will guide instructors during the early stages of their careers.
name: Teaching History
title: WCAS HISTORY 560-0-1 Teaching History

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Students will compile course descriptions and syllabi for one lecture and one seminar course, organize a lecture, compose a teaching statement, and engage in other practical exercises.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: TBA, but the course will not involve a lot of reading. Students will be expected otherwise to focus on preparing for their exams and working on their dissertations
